Franz Schubert

Sonata in F-sharp minor, D 571

1817

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP page 1] · [IMSLP page 2] · [IMSLP page 3]

Total duration: 18' 30"

  • 1. Allegro moderato
  • Andante in A major, D 604
  • Scherzo in D major, D 570/1
  • Allegro in F-sharp minor, D 570/2

The sonata is missing all movements but the first. The missing movements are often taken to be the andante in A major (D 604) and the scherzo in D major and allegro in F-sharp minor (D 570).

Recommended editions

  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/1 · BA 5553 · Klaviersonaten I · ed. Walburga Litschauer [including D 570]
  • Neue Schubert-Ausgabe (Bärenreiter) · VII/2/4 · BA 5525 · Klavierstücke I · ed. David Goldberger [D 604]
  • Associated Board · Complete Pianoforte Sonatas / Volume I · ed. Howard Ferguson [including D 604 and 570]
  • Henle · HN 150 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [including D 604 and 570, with completions of D 571 and 570/2 by Paul Badura-Skoda]
  • Henle · HN 151 · Klaviersonaten / Band III · ed. Paul Mies [including D 604 and 570, with completions of D 571 and 570/2 by Paul Badura-Skoda]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50221 · Sämtliche Klaviersonaten / Band 2 · ed. Martino Tirimo [including D 604 and 570, with completions of D 571 and 570/2 by Martino Tirimo]
  • Wiener Urtext · UT 50294 · Die drei Scherzi für Klavier · ed. Joachen Reutter [D 570/1 only]
